When I started writing I was dumb, naive and stupid. I wanted to look cool to other people. I wanted them to think I am smarter. So I started demeaning people and wrote condescendingly. I thought I was better than other people. Or at least tried to pretend that. For a while I wrote opinions. I demeaned people who were asking obvious questions and I wrote about my thoughts on world economy. And nobody gave a shit. Then I did everything a person can possibly do to destroy his life. Then I got depressed and sad and lost faith in life. I started crying my heart out in writing. I started writing about my insecurities, problems and fears. I wrote all of it. Everything. I didn’t hold back anything. And that added real value to people. They could relate to the experiences I wrote. Document over creating new content. I don’t know why people don’t realize how valuable their day to day experience is to other people. Imagine someone writing their IIM interview rejection story or their experience with depression. Or heck about their struggle with daily laziness. I am definitely listening to all of this. Document whatever small emotion you felt today. You missed your bus? Or liked the food you ate? Or had a quarrel with a sibling? Write about it. People worry about looking stupid and the fear of judgement. I know countless people in my college who are gazillion times more insightful than me but they never create anything. Mostly out of fear of judgement and overthinking their material. They write a stellar quora bio. Or search for expensive cameras on google with a amazing youtube channel name. And then quit the next day. People sometimes message me complementing how beautifully I write. It’s amusing to me. All I do is construct simple sentences , taking care of reader fatigue and mix it with my day to day experiences. If you look carefully, my sentence construction and vocabulary is comparable to a 6th standard school kid. Yet I don’t know why people over complicate things when it comes to generating online content. Trust me when I say this. Forget about quality or the cliches that you might have heard. Just start documenting whatever is happening to you on a daily basis. Nobody cares about presentation after a point as long as you provide continuous value to people. Your genuine honest experiences will ensure that.
